title: resteasy-codestart is picked instead of rest-client-codestart when generating project with rest-client extension

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

body:
### Describe the bug

resteasy-codestart is picked instead of rest-client-codestart when generating project with rest-client extension, e.g.`mvn io.quarkus:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.7.5.Final:create -DprojectGroupId=io.quarkus.qe -DprojectArtifactId=rest-client -DprojectVersion=1.0.0-SNAPSHOT -Dextensions=rest-client`

generated code is for sample JAX-RS endpoint, log also says resteasy-codestart

```
applying codestarts...
[INFO] ğŸ“š  java
ğŸ”¨  maven
ğŸ“¦  quarkus
ğŸ“  config-properties
ğŸ”§  dockerfiles
ğŸ”§  maven-wrapper
ğŸš€  resteasy-codestart
[INFO]
```

### Expected behavior

`ğŸš€  rest-client-codestart` gets picked

### Actual behavior

`ğŸš€  resteasy-codestart` is picked

### How to Reproduce?

 - run `mvn io.quarkus:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.7.5.Final:create -DprojectGroupId=io.quarkus.qe -DprojectArtifactId=rest-client -DprojectVersion=1.0.0-SNAPSHOT -Dextensions=rest-client`
 - check `applying codestarts...` section in the console log

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

Java 17

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.7.5.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
